title: The only way to carry is if those on your team aren't deadbolted to the floor
body:
Your teammates need to at least have the brainpower necessary to _allow_ you to carry.

That means knowing how to itemize correctly, that means knowing how to watch the map and be careful in no-vision areas, that means knowing how to group and defend objectives instead of fucking farming nearby camps and accomplishing nothing.

I can't carry dumbass supports that insist on building {{item:3117}} into the ADs they fed.

I can't carry idiot midlanes that build 0 defense period into enemies with high burst.

I can't carry dumbass ADCs that refuse to play and build defensive and work with the jungler after they fucked up already and gave the enemy a lead.

I can't carry moron junglers that have no inkling of how to so much as assist lanes instead of running into the unwarded enemy jungle trying to get that extra unnecessarily risky farm when the enemy is in a perfect position to collapse on them.

No one can carry with conditions like this.

I'm a Vayne main and I don't ban Caitlyn.

The match up is not as difficult as everyone thinks it is.


All Vayne has to do is get what CS she can WITHOUT DYING.

If she survives until mid game, she outscales Caitlyn.

My 2 most played champs are Caitlyn and MF.

And for some unknown reason my most killed champ last season was Vayne.
The only way to carry is focusing on your own game, not the others. You accomplish nothing and learn nothing by just constantly pointing out your allies' shortcomings.

true years ago
false today
Still true today, you gain nothing by pointing out your allies' shortcomings. You waste your time and your focus getting angry and typing, and they won't play better because of that.

Sometimes, you do make mistakes and the blame is on you. Sometimes, you can player near perfect to what the game needs, and still lose, because teammates are monkeys. Sometimes, you can do mistakes, but they are not big enough to not win you the game.
Not false, but how is that relevant to what am saying?

I'm trying to say that sometimes, blaming the ally is the only thing you can do for a loss. Some games, you either play "perfect" and still lose, or you play well enough to the point that your mistakes didn't cost you the game, but it was what your team did. For example: I'm Sivir, farming it out bot lane. No real advantage I can gain. I'm at 80 cs vs 65 cs on the enemy at 10 minutes, which is a pretty good lead early on, and I've taken half of the enemy tower. I can say I'm doing well for myself, right? Sure, maybe there could b e opportunities where I could have punished the enemy more, denied more cs, maybe even kill the enemy, but I gained an advantage and I didn't give anything to the enemy. At the same time, my Yasuo top is 0/7/0 vs Nasus who is 6/0 something, already having 150 stacks at 10 minutes. I can't really leave bot lane to try and hold Nasus back with a rotation, because then my tower at bot lane falls, and the enemy bot lane gets a free pass to get back in the game and even get stronger than me, while I'm stuck trying to contain the Nasus.

At the end of the day, I played a game where I was either "perfect" or I was good enough that any mistakes didn't really cost me the defeat. At this stage, the only thing I can do is blame my Yasuo for losing me the game. I can definitely check back my own game after, see what I could have done better, but even if I didn't miss a single cs for example, there was basically nothing I could do to stop Nasus. Eventually, Nasus would just bm us outside of our fountain, we couldn't go out because we would die, and he had Frozen Heart, Iceborn Gauntlet and Thornmail with Ninja Tabi, so I was doing negative damage.

> At this stage, the only thing I can do is blame my Yasuo for losing me the game.

At this stage, the best thing you can do is shut your mouth. Blaming Yasuo won't make him play better, won't make you win the game, and will only serve one purpose: you will look like an asshole. And if by chance that game was only 95% lost but not 100%, you're just making sure that now it's certain it's lost.

You gain NOTHING by blaming Yasuo. Not a single damn thing. However small the price it costs you to blame him, it's not worth it, because it's higher than Zero. So shut your mouth and play. You might surrender if your team agrees, but if they don't, respect their decision. And maybe you'll even win the game in the end. Not likely, but everything can happen in SoloQ.
I'm not saying I'm gonna tell Yasuo anything or flame him, I'll keep it to myself, but I will blame him for the loss inside my head.

And I also accomplish nothing and learn nothing by being in a practical 4v5 because that "ally" is worthless and brings nothing to the team.

What did I learn from being in a game with a 3/8 that refuses to back off when they're spam pinged by the team to retreat? That people can be illogical morons that are nothing but a detriment to the team.

Playing from behind is a useful skill. It's going to happen to you, and oftentimes whether or not you wind up behind will be outside your control. Whether or not you are able to win in that situation will vary depending on how good you are at dealing with it though.

Mechanics are important, but so are leadership skills.

And Trias is right, if you waste your time bitching about a teammate who was an idiot instead of figuring out how to convince your teammates to listen to you or figuring out how to negate opposing pressure, then you're still dumpster-ing your own ability to improve and to win.

Not bitching, just pointing out someone being a complete moron after dying for the umpteenth time after you literally spelled it out for them how to avoid that.

And hey, how about you actually set foot in Ranked and then get back to me on that whole "leadership" load of bull you're trying to push, I'm sure you'll get a great response from those hypothetical "teammates" you're defending so hard.

For example, "Build X so you can stop feeding" will just be seen as "you're doing it wrong stop feeding."

Whereas, "hey if you build X you can stop them from killing you next time" will be seen as "you need to do X to help you beat them in the future."
